intro: Henckelia calva, commonly known as the slender henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Henckelia calva has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences.
